channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Perl is more viable for web development than ever!
item.description: Joel Berger wrote a new entry to an old question on StackOverflow and by asking for the support of the community quickly raised to be the number one answer. This is a motivational article. Now go and build a web application in Perl!

item.title: The Case of the Overloaded Curlys
item.description: C. Auguste Dupin helping Tom Wyant in a Perl parsiong problem. Brilliant.

item.title: Startup Row
item.description: JS Smith writes that YAPC::NA is planning to allocated free booth space to Perl based Startup companies. If you are working for one of them, let your management know about this opportunity.

item.title: Modern Perl 2011-2012 Edition Released!
item.description: Last week I already mentioned but I think it is worth mentioning again, now that you can pre-order the book.

item.title: Minimalistic data validation with Validate::Tiny
item.description: Stefan, the minimalist introduces his new module that allows easy data validation.

item.title: ASUS EPU-6 utility hacked with Win32::GuiTest
item.description: Dmitry Karasik mentioned the utility he wrote to automate some small application on MS Windows using a perl script. Code included.

item.title: s/ZeroMQ.pm/ZMQ.pm/g
item.description: Daisuke Maki (lestrrat) has released a new binding to zero.mq and by this he changed the name of the Perl module as well.

item.title: Simple Todo List Processing in Perl
item.description: Mark Fowler explains his TODO processor along with the extract function which is a bit like a two-way grep.

item.title: London Perl Workshop: The Videos
item.description: Mark Keating posted a link the recently finished videos from LPW 2011 and his conclusion about the whole process.

item.title: Looking back, looking forward
item.description: Jonathan Worthington is looking around himself, and especially the progress Perl 6 made in the last year and his plan for the next year.

item.title: Last Piece of Pi
item.description: Solomon Foster (colomon) tells us about his Perl 6 project that a year ago lacked the implementation in both Rakudo and Niecza but today ...

item.title: How to get the Perl Weekly every day?
item.description: If you'd like to get the news of Perl weekly even earlier, or if you'd like to recommend individual posts, you can do that through any of 3 social networks.

item.title: Use of uninitialized value
item.description: Perl can provide various warnings and errors that can be very unclear to people who are new to perl. In this article I try to explain the 'Use of uninitialized value' warning.
